intro: Franciscea hopeana, commonly known as the Maori's tears, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
